did.unittitle: Rives-Troubetzkoy Papers

processinfo.head: Funding Note
processinfo.p: Funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities

did.unittitle: Correspondence, Receipts, Statements, etc., of the Rives Family, chiefly of William Cabell Rives, Sr.and his wife Judith Page Walker Rives, and their children Ella Rives, Amelie Rives, Francis Rives, William Cabell Rives, Jr., and Alfred Landon Rives, covering the years 1800-1855.

Correspondence, Receipts, Statements, etc., of the Rives Family, including some material shedding light on William Cabell Rives, Sr.'s opinion of secession and the Civil War, covering the years 1856-1874.
Correspondence, Receipts, Statements, etc., of the Rives Family, including will and settlement of the estate of William Cabell Rives, Sr.(1868), covering the years 1868-1874.

Correspondence, Receipts, Statements, etc., of the Rives Family, including the will and settlement of the estate of Judith Page Walker Rives(~ 1882), autobiography of Judith Page Walker Rives, papers re: Grace Church(1882- n.d.), covering the years 1875-1889.

Business and Personal Correspondence of the Rives Family, chiefly the correspondence of Alfred Landon Rivesas General Superintendent of the Panama Railroad Company, mainly with E. L. Oppenheim, and correspondence between Alfred Landon Rivesand T. R. Allenregarding investments in Washingtonstate. His interests Railroad Stocks and Mining Stocks. Material pertaining to the economy of Peru. Last Will and Testament of Ella Rives. Last Will and Testament of Sadie C. Rives(wife of Alfred Landon Rives). Covering years 1887-1890.

Business and Personal Correspondence of the Rives Family, chiefly Alfred Landon Rivesand his connections with Panama Railroad Company, the Panama Canal, the Veracruz to Pacific Railroad, the Maryland Trust Company, and T. R. Allenin Washingtonstate, covering the years 1891-1898.
Correspondence, invitations, calling cards, and other undated material, chiefly of the Rives women, particularly during their various stays in Paris.
The original manuscript of the Life and Times of Madison, by William Cabell Rives, Sr., a 3-Volume work published by Little, Brown and Companyin 1859 and 1868, ca. 1000 pages.
did.container: Box VIII, parts A and B

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous literary manuscripts, chiefly of Judith Page Walker Rives(Mrs. William Cabell RivesSr.), including poems, short stories, essays, and translations from French.
An empty scrapbook. William Cabell RivesLedger 1820-1827. 4 Alfred Landon Rivesnotebooks.
Architecture and Engineering Texts and Notes of Alfred Landon Rives, mainly in French.
Architectural notes, textbooks, and drawings of Alfred Landon Rives, mainly in French.
Architecture and Engineering Blueprints of Alfred Landon Rives.
Plans and Achievements of the Interoceanic Canal at Panama, mainly in French, and Alfred Landon Rives's ideas on them.
Oversize Architectural Drawings of Alfred Landon Rives

scopecontent.p: Note: This is a preliminary listing of Rives' drawings in Oversize Tray 40 (folders I -III) and Oversize Tray 41 (folders IV -VIII). For the most part, these are tracings of drawings he made while in Europe in the 1850's as the best examples of bridges employing the latest in construction design and technology, These drawings were repaired by the Barrow Laboratory in Richmond in November 1975 and July 1982. Drawings of buildings in Oversize Tray 8 are not listed
